content.description: The diagram above shows two demand curves for video games identified as <math overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mstyle mathvariant="normal"> <mrow> <mi>D</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> and <math overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mstyle mathvariant="normal"> <mrow> <mi>D</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.
content.question: Which of the following changes will most likely result in a movement from point <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to point <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> along the demand curve <math alttext="D 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: A decrease in the number of buyers
A decrease in the price of video games
A decrease in the expected future price of video games
An increase in the negative effects of video games on players
An increase in the use of video games for educational purposes

content.answer: A decrease in the price of video games

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
